fields.value: Washington Post Maryland Election Day Poll, November 2002

dsDescriptionValue.value:
This special topic poll, conducted November 5, 2002, was  undertaken to assess public opinion on the day of the 2002 Maryland  gubernatorial election. Respondents were asked whether they voted or  were going to vote. If they answered yes, they were asked whether they  voted or would vote for Lieutenant Governor Kathleen Kennedy Townsend  (Democrat) or United States Congressman Robert Ehrlich (Republican)  and why t
hey chose that candidate. Respondents were also asked about  their political orientation and their opinions of the Democratic party, the political party of the current administration.

topicClassValue.value: ICPSR XIV.C.1. Mass Political Behavior and Attitudes, Public Opinion on Political Matters, United States

fields.value: Version Date: 2004-06-17Version Text: 2004-06-17 Subject: null  Type: null  Notes: SPSS portable file;Subject: Study Level Error Note, Notes: (1) Additional information about sampling,  interviewing, weighting, and sampling error may be found in the  codebook. (2) The data are provided as an SPSS portable file. (3) This  collection has not been processed by ICPSR staff. ICPSR is  distributing the data and documentation for this collection in  essentially the same form in which they were received. When  appropriate, documentation has been converted to Portable Document  Format (PDF), data files have been converted to non-platform-specific  formats, and variables have been recoded to ensure respondents'  privacy. (4) The codebook is provided by ICPSR as a Portable  Document Format (PDF) file. The PDF file format was developed by Adobe  Systems Incorporated and can be accessed using PDF reader software,  such as the Adobe Acrobat Reader. Information on how to obtain a copy of the Acrobat Reader is provided on the ICPSR Web site.; Subject: null  Type: null  Notes: SPSS portable file(s), and electronic documentation.;

distributorName.value: Inter-university Consortium for Political and Social Research

distributorAffiliation.value: Institute for Social Research, University of Michigan

value: Persons aged 18 and over living in households with telephones in the state of Maryland.

fields.value: Households from the WASHINGTON POST MARYLAND GOVERNOR'S  RACE POLL, OCTOBER 2002 (ICPSR 3776), were called again. The  respondent was asked to answer additional questions. In the event that  the respondent previously queried was not home, a new respondent was  chosen. The new respondent selected was the adult living in the  household who last had a birthday and who was home at the time of the interview.
